Reviews.Title: “ideal location”
Reviews.Author: gjp_11
Reviews.Content: Based on the comments of tripadvisor we selected this hotel for a long weekend. The hotel is clean and the staff is friendly, but what makes this hotel special is its location: absolutely great in front of the Panteon on a very attractive square, with may other attractions nearby. What was disappointing though was the size of the room in combination with the price they ask. One pays here for the location not for the quality of the hotel (room). Also the breakfast wasn't of a great quality. So all in all we were suprised that the hotel was ranked so high. We had mixed feelings.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: pjriccio
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the Piazza della Rotunda, in front of one of my favorite anciant Roman monuments, the Pantheon. It's in walking distance to most of the must see ruins; (Roman Forum, Palintine, Carcall Baths, and also many Museums. The rooms are a bit on the small side, but the view from room 405 was spectacular! A very good Breakfast was included, offering eggs, bread rolls, fruit yogert, cold meats, coffee and tarts. I would return!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here for location, not for luxury.”
Reviews.Author: ocavanag
Reviews.Content: If you stay here be sure to get a room overlooking the front square. I've stated twice, one time was awful and one time was great.. all down to the room. The awful time was in a very dark little room at the back of the hotel, really depressing. The other time was in a corner room at the front, such a contrast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: curlew
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Abruzzi for a vcouple of nights, on the posirtive side the hotel is in a great locations, room was clean, the lower rooms can be affected by noise fropm the square, so if you are a light sleeper you can be woken by the drunken revellers. You can reach all the main attractions easily, service was good, but one oif the staff members opening the door without knocking during our stay is the reason for downgrading to three.

Reviews.Title: “Ready to stay there again”
Reviews.Author: JLA352
Reviews.Content: Very good service, clear explanations to help find locations we wanted to visit. The room was small, but clean and comfortable, with an impressive view on the Patheon square. The noise of the people on the square (no cars) did not prevent us from sleeping. The WiFi is with an extra charge but works well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ssbalcis
Reviews.Content: You can't find a better location for a long weekend trip to Rome. We had a view to Pantheon from our room. The rooms are small, clean and modern. The room size can be a problem if you are with kids. Otherwise nothing to complain. Overall I was very happy to reach all attractions on foot. Not even public transport (except Vatican).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and....that's all”
Reviews.Author: Alexutz_m
Reviews.Content: This hotel gets 4 starts from me only for the location (the location is actually 5 stars and the hotel....2 1/2). As in most of the Rome's city centre hotels, the rooms are insanely small. A single room has about 12 sqm with a small single bed and "view" of the hotel's shaft. The double room is still under 20 sqm with queen size bed but once you open the window and you see the Pantheon you'll forget about how uncomfortable and old the room is. There's no elevator and you'll have breakfast in the hotel's bar which it's actually perfect for the view. The good part is that you are in front of the Pantheon so you can't get better than this if you want to wander around. If you think about renting a car, consider that the entire area is closed and during the weekends the restrictions are even wider so you would end up parking the car at minimum 1Km away from the hotel. The taxis have no problems getting to the hotel. The hotel reception is good including the night shift. The rooms are not so clean and the furniture is old. Considering the above and the price, I'll most probably chose another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean and affordable”
Reviews.Author: Edinct
Reviews.Content: Great location. We had a family room, two adjoining rooms sharing a bathroom. Clean and functional, but everything was very small - both bedrooms not much bigger than than the beds, and not much room to move around in the bathroom (or shower for that matter!). We were told we would have a room with a view, but barely - one tiny window that you had to lean over to see. I'm sure many of the other rooms have better views. Our room faced the square, on the fourth floor, not too noisy. You need to walk up one flight of stairs to get to the tiny and slow elevator. Internet is not free and a bit expensive (2 Euros per hour). Breakfast was just OK, walk across the piazza for some baked goods, eggs and bacon. Staff was very nice, recommended a great pizza restaurant nearby. Can't say enough about the location, vibrant, central, yet not too noisy and very safe.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: beauNj
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here 3/11/12-3/18/12. and loved it! I am "directionally challenged" so wanted a place that anyone could tell us how to get bact to-perfect! Our view was right across from the Pantheon and directly over the Piazza. We loved being able to hear the street musicians and the crowds- it made us feel connected to the city even when we were resting. You can walt to almost anywhere you want to go from the hotel, and the people at the front desk, especially Simone and Valentina, give excellent directions. If you dont want to walk, the bus stop is close, and there are taxis right next to the Pantheon. The rooms are small, but very clean and comfortable. The WiFi is not free, but it is fast. There are plenty of good places to eat nearby. If you are looking for comfort and convienience, but not luxury, this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Dolce Vitta on perfect location”
Reviews.Author: IvanaBasa
Reviews.Content: When I read the reviews and saw that everyone are highlighting the location, I was afraid that the only quality of this hotel is a location. However I was pleasantly surprised - rooms are practically decorated, newly furnished and very clean (i have to mention that I stayed in the annex part, which is just 2 doors from the main hotel entrance). Staff in the hotel are very nice. Breakfast is served in the restaurant on the piazza in front of Pantheon, so you get to enjoy rare peaceful morning moments in front of this breathtaking sight while munchkin on croissant and coffee. Next to the hotel is also an excellent cafe bar. Great location, and excellent package all together :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Mike S
Reviews.Content: Hotel is small but plenty of room. Location is excellent and we had a great view out our window. I would recommend Hotel Abruzzi to all.

Reviews.Title: “Location,Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Medfly42
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a central location with an excellent staff - you have found your hotel. The rooms are standard European size with a small showers stall. The rooms are clean and the staff is excellent. Go ahead and pay more for the Pantheon view - you may not spend much time in your room, but when you do, it sure is an awesome sight. The location leaves you walking distance to pretty much everything to see in Rome. Great places to eat, shop and have coffee or gelato are less than a 5 min walk ( that includes a supermarket as well). There can be some noise from the square, but nothing to be concerned about.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, faultless location”
Reviews.Author: Beckstars
Reviews.Content: Yes it's expensive for what it is, but it's opposite the Pantheon! Friendly staff, nice rooms and okay breakfast. Perfect for exploring Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Feel The Culture of Rome!”
Reviews.Author: David J
Reviews.Content: If you look out your window or step outside the door of the hotel you feel the culture of Rome! The hotel is very clean and the staff is most helpful and accommodating. You will have the opportunity to have a complimentary breakfast buffet within steps of the Pantheon. There are delightful side streets full of restaurants; the only problem is having so many it is hard to choose just one! The hotel is basic but very charming and quaint; certainly with much more character than your large chain hotels. At night the piazza comes alive with entertainment and a flurry of activity which creates an evening of treasured memories. The hotel has reasonable prices; especially when you make a reservation in advance or take advantage of their specials. This is definitely the hotel to add to your trip of a lifetime ... when in Rome do as the Romans do!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a charming place”
Reviews.Author: tsovs
Reviews.Content: Piazza della Rotonda is our favorite place in Rome. Last year we stayed at the hotel Albergo Del Senato which is located less than 30 metres from the Hotel Abruzzi. At this time we have decided to book the Hotel Abruzzi, and have not regretted this choice. We stayed at this hotel at the room 406 overlooking Piazza della Rotunda and Pantheon for 2 nights in early January. The room was very clean and comfortable. The breakfast was served at cafe across the piazza della Rotonda. For breakfast you should get a voucher at the reception. The cafe has terrific views of the square and the Pantheon. The staff were all extremely friendly and very helpful. Hotel Albergo Abruzzi is located in the heart of the city centre. The location of this hotel is one of the best in Rome. I would highly recommend this hotel to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and convenient to most places of interest”
Reviews.Author: Earlsf211
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. Very safe and convenient to most places. Free breakfast is a great start for a day for sightseeing. The Piazza where the hotel is itself a good place for food. Rooms are on the small side but very clean and modern. Staff are great and helpful. My first three days wifi not working but they finally figured it out after a few complaints:) it would be even better if it's for free!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: MissP2012
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I missed out on staying in one of the rooms opposite the Pantheon but it didnt spoil my experience of the hotel. The staff were really helpful, helped with bags, gave advice on how to get to different places etc. The room as small, as you would expect for Rome, but it was clean and really comfortable. The breakfast was really good - if I remember rightly, you are given a voucher to use at one of the restaurants just yards from the hotel. It was a decent breakfast but the highlight was sitting outside and watching the world go by, right outside the Pantheon! I would stay here again but try to get one of the rooms overlooking the Piazza next time if I am lucky.

Reviews.Title: “First rome visit”
Reviews.Author: Niamh S
Reviews.Content: Centrally located with in easy reach of "old rome" and the tourists attractions. Travellilng solo felt quite confident in the area day and night. Room small, ( as is more usual in Italy/Venice) and with a view of the Pantheon, great. Staff polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Excellent View”
Reviews.Author: LinnyB2709
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this delightful little hotel for 4 nights, We stayed in room 405 and by paying just a little extra, had the most wonderful view of the Pantheon. The room was very clean and for Rome very spacious, ok the bathroom was on the small side but you don't spend all your time in there, it had a toilet, shower, bidet and a sink unit, what more could you want. The towels were changed every day. Even in January we found we were having to open the windows just to watch and listen to the people wandering through this delightful Roman piazza, and the entertainment by the buskers was also delightful. It didn't bother us having to pop across the piazza to the resturant for breakfast. The staff were very welcoming and could not have treated us better, always answering our questions. The lift starts on the 1st floor which is up approximately 15 stairs. This hotel is right in the middle of all the sights, we were a short bus ride away from the Vatican and the Colousseum, From the Hotel its just a short walk to the Trevi Fountain then onto the Spannish Steps. We found everyone offered us help when looking at maps or trying to work out the buses. BIG TIP.... buy a bus map of Rome.. its a must have and makes things really easy. Only downside...... tons of peddlers, trying to sell you roses and gadget things that light up, oh and also beware, at the Colosseum and outside the Pantheon you will see people dressed as Gladiators, they do try and get you to have your photo taken with them (using your camera) then you pay for that priviledge. Make sure you take very comfortable shoes ........... there's a lot of walking.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Elena R
Reviews.Content: It was great vacations in Rome. The most astonishing was the location! Breakfast was great as well. Staff is helping and easy-going. However, I should admit, you can't describe rooms as spasious. For elder people could be a problem using an elevator( it's working with the 1st floor). To sum up, I've stayed content with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “PAY THE EXTRA TO GET A VIEW OF THE PANTHEON!”
Reviews.Author: KimPreston
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights - we got a good price booking about 1 week before. We stayed in room 405, on the fourth floor. The view of the Pantheon was wonderful. The room was quite spacious, clean and simply decorated. The bathroom was extremely small and as has been mentioned by other reviewers - its could be a tight squeeze to get into the shower. You do not stay at this hotel for luxury - but for its location. We thoroughly enjoyed the entertainers who come into the piazza to sing or play instruments. You cannot hear much once the windows are closed and the piazza quietens down relatively early. The breakfast which is served across the piazza at a cafe is acceptable. The staff at the hotel were very pleasant and apart from having to wait for the taxi - which had been arranged by the hotel for about 30 minutes - the transfers from the airport to the hotel went well. We would certainly stay at this hotel again dependant on the price. We visit Rome a couple of times a year and the location of this hotel is one of the best in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot have a better view (or value)”
Reviews.Author: LoveIntlTravel
Reviews.Content: I've stayed twice in this gem of a hotel over the last few months and it just fits the bill perfectly. The location cannot be better -- open the windows onto the Pantheon a few meters away!!!! There's nothing quite as astonishing as seeing this perfect Roman piazza at all times of day and night, from the crowds of locals and tourists to the silent nights with only the fountain splashing. The staff (reservation and check-in/out) is extremely nice and dependable -- terrific conversations! The rooms are pretty, with nice decor that lower-range hotels in Italy rarely have, though they vary in size, and the bathrooms brand-new. The breakfast is huge. The price is extremely low for the quality, the location smack in the heart of the historic center, and the views. Definitely my fist call for a stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Charming European-style with Unbeatable Location”
Reviews.Author: MarkofBurbank
Reviews.Content: My wife and I loved this hotel. We stayed in two different rooms, one on the 4th floor (3rd piano) and one on the 5th in December 2011 and then in January 2012. The location is perfect for those wanting to stroll the Centro Storico and we couldn't stop gazing at the view of the Pantheon and the the transformation of the Piazza de la Rotunda from early-morning emptiness with cleaning crews and restaurants setting up to crowded with tourists over the course of the day. The rooms are very clean and the bathrooms were fine for us, but an overly large person might have difficulty getting into the small shower stalls. The front-desk staff, especially Simone and Anthony were always very helpful. One does have to negotiate one flight of steps to reach the small lift. Breakfast is across the piazza, which is fun to traverse in the morning, and included eggs, some meats for those want them, cheese, a nice assortment of pastries, fruit, and cereal + hot drinks. The only negative point we experienced was that, while the hotel is a non-smoking hotel, cigarette smoke sometimes wafts upstairs from the downstairs foyer. One other great point about the locale - there is a taxi stand that operates most of the day in the nearby piazza.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Welcoming Staff, Unreal Location”
Reviews.Author: Tommy A
Reviews.Content: My mom and I went to Rome, it was her first time out of the country and we booked a trip thorugh expedia - we spent a few extra euros on this hotel because of the location. We had a room that looke out over the piazza and the pantheon...AMAZING!! We also found the staff to be very helpful with any of our questions and the restaurant recommendations were terrific. The rooms were very clean and water pressure was good and there was plenty of hot water. I would go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: pgadvertising
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel! at the time we arrived with my wife and my daughter (2years old) at 10:00 pm after a long fly tired... on dec 25 I was informed that I booked for a single room with no view at the pantheon but Antonio the front desk person upgraded for free to a double room suite with pantheon view on the 3rd floor!!! , they try to make you feel special and this is priceless in europe, I really recommend this hotel don't look for more the location is the best. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Great location but becoming run down”
Reviews.Author: tuxedoSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: This is our third time to the Abruzzi in 4 years. The first time was wonderful and so was the second time; 2 years later for this stay this week, we found a very tired run down feeling in the basic amenities. There is no question this is a hotel with a great location. The Pantheon and the square are right below and across from your windows. You walk to everything you wish to see and do. But sadly it has not kept up the important things that make a basic stay comfortable and pleasurable. For example the silver finish was peeling off the faucet, the towel rack was all banged up, the shower faucet holder was missing parts and exposing the pipes, there was only one blanket, no comforter, and the towels were rather thin. My traveling partner noticed there was a lot of silicone covering leaky joints in the travertine tiles which is a bandaid for leaky tiles but does not look very good. The floor formerly carpeted is now cheap plastic to look like wood. It could use a major make over. If you are staying in a budget hotel you expect these kinds of things but that is not the case for this hotel. It is not a budget hotel it is in the middle price range and in the heart of the city. I think though the reception was exceptional; very very nice people and kind. Also you have to walk up one stair flight with your bags to get to the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: nschaff
Reviews.Content: My two daughters and I stayed here for 4 days in April. The staff were wonderful! When the airlines lost some of our luggage, they called all night to help us trace it. Not only were the staff wonderful, but the location is amazing!! Outside our window we had a fantastic view of the Pantheon, and enjoyed the people watching every morning and night. We could walk to everywhere in Rome from the central location. When we return, we will not stay anywhere else!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: catbarone
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great, the staff were very friendly and you could not ask for a better location in Rome! We had a wonderful view of the Pantheon and the piazza in front of the Pantheon, but with the window closed the noise was minimal. It seems most of Italy has beds on the hard side and these were no exception, but we did just fine. We would choose this hotel again next time!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: LosRobinson
Reviews.Content: We chose the Hotel Abruzzi because of its location and were not disappointed. We could walk to everywhere we wanted to see and have the advantage of being in a great piazza, too. The hotel was clean and the staff was knowledgeable and friendly. Good restaurants were close by as well as good shopping. The window view onto the piazza was beautiful -- there was always something to see.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, very clean, recommended.”
Reviews.Author: HertzVR
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights in December, warm enough for us to eat in the Piazza Rotunda for both nights out in the open; its a great time of year to see the city. The hotel was easy to find, and is without doubt the best location to explore the classical side of the city; ALL the major sites can be reached within 20 minutes walking, there is no need to use any transport really. The hotel is split into the more traditional side, and the annex. We were in the annex, which whilst I cant say was particularly charming (its like a more colourful travelodge sort of accomodation), it was very clean. Whilst you dont get a view of the Pantheon here, the side streets are also very pleasant, and the door to the annex comes out onto the Piazza. The area quietened down at nights, which was a relief as our windows didnt fully close. Also, despite being quiet, the hot water ran out very quickly in the shower. The showers are a decent size in the newer annex, but be sure to get up early for that hot water! Breakfast in the cafe presented a very reasonable selection, and provided an excellent start to the day. It is a buffet style meal, but things were kept topped up and although nothing was outstanding, its certainly a bonus to have breakfast watching the city start to come alive again in the morning, as you can eat in the Piazza. WiFi was not provided, a little disappointed at a hotel of this price. There was the option to pay for a time allocation, but it was comically high so no real option.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location; excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: uropwide
Reviews.Content: I chose the Abruzzi on the basis of other Tripadvisor reviews, and it certainly lived up to expectations. Although a bit more expensive than other hotels I looked at (all further out from the centre), it scored because of its prime location and the reviews, well deserved, of its friendliness and service. Do not assume all hotels offer courtesy and good service in Rome! Emails were answered promptly and accurately, and the reception staff were all excellent in their attitude and helpfulness. This was a short trip for my wife and I on our first trip to Rome, although I had been there briefly on business some 2 decades before. So we needed somewhere central, within easy walking distance of the major sights. Abruzzi cannot be more central. Arriving early evening - by the way, if you do not know Rome, take the hotel's offer of a private car to/from the airport, well worth the money to avoid the hassle - we wandered out to find a place to eat. Ignoring the hustlers in the cafes around the Piazza del Rotunda, we found ourselves less than 5 minutes window-shopping time later in Pzza Navona. Christmas market in full swing and a pleasant restaurant with an adequate menu. On subsequent days, 10 minutes stroll could have got us to Trevi and the confection of the Vitt Emanuele II "wedding cake" - shopping made both excursions considerably longer! As other reviewers write, with the hotel's good sound-proofing the noise in the piazza doesn't percolate sufficiently to stop a good night's sleep. The room was surprisingly big and airy, with plenty of manoeuvring room and space for suitcases. We have stayed at other places of an equivalent star rating with rooms that were distinctly cramped. Breakfast is in a cafe across the square and plentiful, though the scrambled eggs deposited fresh into the hot tray were cold; also ask for expresso or capuccino, as the coffee from the flask is awful. This is not under the hotel's control though. We had two and a half days of shopping and sightseeing and regretfully left, albeit a bit footsore, promising ourselves to return - naturally to the Abruzzi. One criticism of the otherwise very acceptable compact bathroom is that anyone of, shall we say, a stout build will find closing and opening the shower door a challenge, as the gap between the door and the shower reduces to about 30cm. Fortunately we are both slim, but even so it was a bit of a squeeze.

Reviews.Title: “Superb loaction, friendly staff, very clean, quite small”
Reviews.Author: RichardGr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend in Rome and on the whole it was fantastic. It was clean, the staff were friendly, the location is fantastic, the breakfasts in the cafe across the square were perfectly decent - the view from the window was brilliant even if you weren't looking at the Pantheon, there was always something good happening in the square, especially in the evening with opera singers, Pink Floyd-esq buskers, classical musicians, marching band on Sunday etc. Wonderful. On the negative sides, our room was the only room in the hotel next to the toilet which was for staff use (room 106 I think), so at very early o'clock we were awoken by the sound of a toilet being flushed. The room was very small (not a problem) but the shower cubicle was tiny. Once in, the shower was very good (powerful and hot) but if you are fuller figured, it may be a squeeze to get through the cubicle doors. And (no fault of the hotel) the noise/music in the square carries on well into the evening, so on day 2, I bought some ear plugs from the local pharmacy - problem solved. If the rooms were not well double glazed it would be much louder. We would be more than happy to stay there again as the price (we feel) was good. We walked to all the major attractions from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “speechless!!!”
Reviews.Author: pvp60Dublin_Ireland
Reviews.Content: hotel arranged car to meet us at airport. beautiful car with courteous driver! hotel location is truly wonderful! hotel rooms spotless. staff were mannerly to a fault and so helpful!!! bars and restaurants nearby had wonderful ambience !!! what a 60th birthday with all my family in bella roma!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: luv2paint
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful place to stay. We stayed for 6 nights in November 2011. We had a room on 4th floor that overlooked Piazza Rotonda with the Pantheon and Fountain in full view. We arrived to find a bottle of wine and a bowl of fruit in our room. It was great to hear the musicians and the water of the fountain in the piazza below. When it was time to retire we simply closed the soundproof windows and it was quiet. The staff was extremely helpful and polite. Always greet you with a smile and knew your room number. We have been to Rome 6 times in the last 3 years and this is our favorite hotel. Great location....you can walk to everything or there is a taxi waiting just across the piazza. Breakfast buffet is at a restaurant across the piazza and we found we enjoyed the short walk in the morning when things are just beginning to stir. This hotel made us feel more a part of Rome. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended - and rightly so!”
Reviews.Author: GJSPrince
Reviews.Content: This was a 'Thank You' trip for my Mum, sister and best friend; the latter had stayed at the Abruzzi a few years ago. She recommended it as being in a great location, clean and comfortable, nothing fancy but friendly and good value for money. She was absolutely right and, even though you still have to carry your cases up to the first floor to catch the lift (not a problem for us with hand luggage), it had even improved since her last stay with a rerfurbished reception/entrance lobby. We spent a long weekend and couldn't fault the hotel. Yes, the rooms are snug but a) we weren't planning to spend much time in them and b) knew in advance what to expect. My sister joined us on the second day and had her own (double) room while my friend and I shared a suite with my mother; she had the single room and we shared a double bed (no twin option.) I'm not a great sleeper nowadays, but I was amazed at how well I slept - all the walking helped but the bed was comfortable too (even with my friend in it for the first time since school days.) When we were shown into the room (2nd floor, corner over the reception at the front, overlooking the Pantheon), my heart sank at the prospect of trying to sleep with all the crowds down below living La Dolce Vita half the night but, to my very pleasant surprise, everything was silent by midnight and the buzz didn't start until 8ish in the morning. I would very happily stay there again and even look forward to it - there's a good view of the Pantheon from the room! The bathroom was clean and adequate for three ladies sharing. There's also good aircon, which quickly but gently cooled down the rooms whenever we returned; we switched it off at night, opened the windows (lovely fresh air, no noise) and were comfortable. A great new addition from my friend's last trip was the breakfast facility at a local cafe in the square. You also get a discount, as a hotel customer, on any meals, snacks or drinks consumed there at other times. Very handy for meeting up and next door to a fabulous deli where we picked up lunch one day to eat in a park. The Pantheon is so central, we walked everywhere, in every direction, and easily found our way back to Abruzzi. We couldn't have been better located. Thank you to Valentina and Simone (a gent) who were as helpful and friendly during our stay as they were in answering my queries and dealing with our change of dates when I was arranging the trip. I look forward to next time!

Reviews.Title: “A place I would recommend to friends”
Reviews.Author: skoay1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Abruzzi for 3 nights in September 2011. We asked for the Pantheon view and were given Room 301 , the room like most European inner city Inns, is small but adequate with clean and modern toilets. Since it is facing the Pantheon square,it's a bit noisy during the day but ok after midnight. Very central and convenient, just a few meters away, you have one of the best cafes, gelato parlors and restaurents . Very good breakfasts which are included but not in the same building, just across the street. Friendly and helpful front counter staffs . Taxis are easy available as they parked just next to the Pantheon. Value for money .However , no free WiFi and might not work if you are using samsung tablets (?!) Apples are ok, the staffs are still trying to figure out why, they are having the same problem !

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: drewski711
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a moderately priced hotel with a good location in Rome as we were going to be meeting friends and only had 48 hrs to see the city. The Abruzzi was great for our needs. We had an incredible view of the Pantheon from our room. The rooms/showers were average for Rome but very clean. The staff was incredibly helpful and friendly. Breakfast is a buffet at a restaurant across the piazza and was solid. Great coffee/gelato very close by (Tazza d'oro is around the corner). Of note- we did have to drag our bags up and down one flight of stairs as the elevator doesn't go to to the first floor. Also, don't think about driving here- take a cab if at all possible.

Reviews.Title: “from Geneva, Switzerland...”
Reviews.Author: William B
Reviews.Content: I have been to Rome several times and there is not a better situated hotel than the Hotel Abruzzi. It is right in front of the Pantheon and convenient to everything! The hotel is lovely, with spacious bedrooms (for Rome). I was there during the notorious heat wave of summer and the air conditioning was perfect. The rooms were clean and well-kept and had every convenience you could want. Breakfast was in a beautiful restaurant on pantheon Square and was very nice with a wide and varied selection. Even though I have stayed at much more famous hotels in Rome, I can't imagine ever staying anywhere but the Hotel Abruzzi again. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent , Excellent, Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Fattybombalati
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Abruzzi in November 2011. Though a little small, the room was spotless everyday! The staff was extremely friendly and warm! Valentina and the gentleman ( Sorry forgot his name) always greeted us with a smile! All in all, a wonderful place to stay! P.S: We literally walked EVERYWHERE!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous boutique hotel, Do Not Miss!”
Reviews.Author: Michael S
Reviews.Content: If you want a unique hotel and experience, you must pick this hotel. Firstly, this is a small intimate boutique hotel with beautiful rooms. Second, the location!!! You can walk to virtually anywhere- and we did. This is the first time I had been to Rome where I thought it was as easy to navigate as Florence. Thirdly, the food. My husband still talks about the sumptuous breakfast that was included in the price and the proscuitto de parma ham. This is a place for lovers and memories. DO NOT MISS!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended hotel”
Reviews.Author: pmooneynet
Reviews.Content: My wife and I brought my mother to Rome over the weekend just past. Rome was on her "Bucket list" and this hotel had been recommended to us. Location is simply fantastic. We were in room 105/106 and the views were brilliant. The plaza outside is lively but when you close the windows it is quiet enough. Rooms are small but clean. Staff are friendly and helpful. I would go back here and I would also recommend this hotel to anyone going to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Rome!!”
Reviews.Author: Laragazzaturca77
Reviews.Content: Location of this hotel is unbeatable!! You will be facing the Pantheon from your room, worth every penny to upgrade to a room with a view. Friendly staff, professional. Clean, well taken care of rooms. From outside building looks really old but inside they have done a good job renovating... If you are in Rome for 2-3 days, totally worth it to stay here!!! Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and View”
Reviews.Author: pharmher
Reviews.Content: We knew we were going to have a view of the Pantheon, but not one that filled the entire window! We stayed on the 4th floor and our room was pristinely clean. If you are claustrophobic, you probably won't like the elevator or the shower, but I had absolutely no issues as the trade off is a professional staff that is helpful (helped us with bus routes and maps), the best location, and of course THE VIEW. When I posted a pick on my Facebook profile of our view, my friends couldn't believe it. We thoroughly enjoyed the complimentary breakfast at Scusate il Ritardo in the square - it was delcious and refreshing to eat outside. Everywhere we went was either within walking distance or a short bus ride. The Colusseum was only 3 or 4 bus stops away, and there is an express bus to the Vatican. The hotel is also a great area to go on a stroll at night. We did the night walking tour that Rick Steves recommended in his book which took us to the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps. All of this plus a stop for dinner and gelato at Giolitti's was accomplised within 3 hrs. Do try to experience the piazza in the early morning before all the tourists arrive - it is quite lovely. Also, booking online through their website was a breeze - they respond quickly and helpfully. They even accomodated adding on an additional night after we had made our reservations. We would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Stupendous view & staff!”
Reviews.Author: Eager_Traveler33
Reviews.Content: When they stated "Pantheon View," I had no idea I could sell the photos from my bedroom and bathroom windows as postcards!! IDEAL location to walk everywhere, quaintly small but spotless rooms, and convenient vouchers for breakfast buffet at a plaza restaurant where you can continue to view the Pantheon. 3 staff members were VERY helpful, and I particularly want to thank Simon, who not only printed up train schedules to Sorrento for us, but he also marked maps in his meticulously refined handwriting and even provided us the Wikipedia printout on Sorrento so we wouldn't miss any highlights! They are proud of their lovely, charming hotel and eager to please visitors. Thanks!!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Hotel in Unbeatable Location”
Reviews.Author: Romagnome
Reviews.Content: From the reservations to the check-out, one of the most hassle-free travel experiences we've had. Front desk staff is wonderful (there are only three, so you always have a friendly and familiar face upon your return). Rooms and bathrooms are small by American standards, but it's a tiny old building--they've done a good job with the space they have. Very clean and the bathrooms are modern. There is an elevator (small, mostly for bags or 2 people) but it is located on first floor. Upon arrival, an employee carried our bags for us to the first floor, then we used the elevator. This might be an issue for people with mobility difficulties. The windows are double-glazed, so noise is not an issue unless you are a terrifically light sleeper. This was a concern for me, as a previous trip spent near Piazza Navona was marred by old windows that let in every bit of noise. Also, the trash trucks don't arrive until around 7 AM, as opposed to 5 AM in the Navona area. :) The view--amazing. Our room (405) overlooked the fountain but you could easily see the whole Pantheon without hanging out the window. The pictures posted on review are accurate; the Pantheon is really really "in your face". Breakfast across the square at Scusate il Ritardo restaurant. Very good buffet with scrambled eggs and bacon, cold cuts and cheese and a wide variety of pastries was offered every morning. You can sit outside if you like or in the charming dining room. Will definitely stay there again, and recommend it whole-heartedly based upon my experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay”
Reviews.Author: OrionNYC
Reviews.Content: The location is so good we almost never took taxis. It is small and, truthfully, not over fancy which is just fine. The staff was always friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and the view was amazing. There is no restaurant in the hotel but breakfast is at a small cafe a few steps across the cobblestone plaza. In so many ways that is more charming that a hotel restaurant, There is certainly no shortage of other restaurant options in that part of Rome for lunch or dinner. Would not hesitate to stay there again or recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “great location!”
Reviews.Author: Deb W
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the 8 days we spend here. Location is truly central to everything, we walked everywhere. Room with Pantheon view was very good. Although the piazza is very busy, there is little noise in the room once the shutters and windows are closed. Staff friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Rexanne
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Hotel Abruzzi. The location is beautiful and perfect. Rooms are small but clean, quiet, and comfortable. My window overlooked the square, but it was never noisy. The staff was very accommodating and gracious. The free breakfast is at an excellent restaurant on the square next to a gorgeous fountain and a stone's throw from the Pantheon. What's not to like? I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: 31CoryB
Reviews.Content: We could have thrown a stone from our front door to the Pantheon. But outside of the location, the staff was very accomodating, providing strong restaurant recommendations and other handy local information. Our room had double-paned windows, so if we closed the windows we were not bothered by street noise (which greatly dropped in volume after 11 PM). Our room was spotless, and housekeeping did an admirable job cleaning up after our dusty feet every day. The breakfast set-up was perfect - it was wonderful to start each day with a view of the piazza. As long as you can live in a small space, you'll be delighted with your choice!

Reviews.Title: “A small hotel that ticks all of the boxes”
Reviews.Author: bjproject31
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on its position and previous reviews. I can now say that it exceeded all of our expectations. The position is perfect to explore by foot all of the attractions of ancient Rome plus the Vatican. The room was very well maintained and comfortable with good air con. The breakfast arrangements with the restaurant in the square worked very well and they also gave 15% discount on other meals. The staff we all very helpful and always there to assist on any questions or suggestions. If you want to avoid the major chains and find a good value and well placed hotel in Rome look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing View!”
Reviews.Author: hff
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel on September 23-24th. Our room faced the Pantheon and the view was absolutely glorious. The Pantheon is literally a few feet away from the hotel. As a result it is a bit noisy but I think that adds to the charm. This hotel is all about the view. The hotel itself offers no frills but you don't mind when you look out your window. There is no lobby to speak of when you enter the front door and breakfast is offered across the Piazza. I would recommend staying here just for a few nights. Since the hotel itself is lacking any frills. Make sure you request a view of the Pantheon when making reservations or you could end up in the Annex with no view to speak of.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: melssNewYork
Reviews.Content: Hotel Abruzzi is in the PERFECT location, right across the piazza from the Pantheon. The piazza is a gorgeous site. You could sit there for hours. Everything in Rome is within walking distance of Hotel Abruzzi. The rooms are clean, spacious, and housekeeping tidies up daily. Bathroom is clean, not very big. The front desk was always courteous, friendly and helpful (want a recommendation for dinner? where to get the best gellato?) Breakfast is included with your reservation, served a short walk across the piazza. There is music in the piazza every night, but I was so tired it didn't keep me awake. This hotel had everything to do with making my first trip to Rome fantastic. I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot be beaten”
Reviews.Author: Gemma B
Reviews.Content: The best location in the heart of Rome. Walking distance to everything. have breakfast on the piazza looking at the pantheon and the fountain. Views of the rotunda from rooms (although not in rooms of the annex). Have stayed here twice and will stay again happily. staff are helpful and friendly with excellent english. rooms are very clean. internet must be bought and is only available in common areas. no noise issues

Reviews.Title: “Would be average except for a few glaring issues”
Reviews.Author: Cedric U
Reviews.Content: Hotel is basically fine, great location and view (but there are others). The elevator is the slowest on earth so be aware if you end up on the upper floors or have difficulty with stairs. They have no breakfast there but set you up with a buffet across the piazza. Pretty bad buffet. Lastly and worst, during a national transportation strike (which is more and more likely to become frequent in Italy (see the Greece economy)), I couldn't make it on the correct day. I had my hotel in another city call and cancel and then the day before my reservation I emailed them another cancellation. Short version, they charged me anyway even though when I called to ask for a similar room, pretending to be someone else, they said they had no availability. Also, you are right by the Pantheon so it's noisy. Bear it in mind. I felt it was pretty poor hospitality

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: DublinNina
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in a fantastic location the rooms are basic you have to go across the road for breakfeast but thats not a problem the staff are very helpfull

Reviews.Title: “We had a great experience”
Reviews.Author: Peter L
Reviews.Content: This hotel is idally located. A lot of the major sites (and many of the minor ones) are within walking distance. Moreover, its location right at the Pantheon makes it very easy to get taxi drivers to find it easily, which is not rue when you are staying at most small hotels in major cities. The room was clean as could be and the desk personnel had a good command of English. In addition they were extremely helpful in making arrangements for tours, taxis, etc. We will definitely stay here again when we are next in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in the perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: peaches3010
Reviews.Content: My stay started off on a high with a free upgrade from a single room to a double room with king sized bed and a direct and full on view of the Pantheon! All the staff were friendly and helpful beyond expectations. The room was spotlessly clean, comfortable and spacious. The location was puuurrfect - amazing atmosphere right at the square, vibey and lots of places to eat at (take away and sit down). Also within comfortable walking distance to main attractions. The only minor problem was with wi-fi but I was not in my room long enough for it to matter all that much. I would absolutely stay at Hotel Abruzzi again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Mick R
Reviews.Content: Perhaps one of the best locations in Rome. Friendly staff, clean comfortable room. We unfortunately fell foul of a national travel strike in Italy the day we were due to arrive in Rome and were subsequently delayed by one day and unable to modify our reservation in time. Whilst this was completely out of our hands the hotel still charged us 100% of the room fee! Though this is strictly in accordance with their cancellation policy we were disapointed that they were not prepared to provide some discount. Be prepared in case this happens to you!

Reviews.Title: “Fourth stay at Abruzzi”
Reviews.Author: STCorcoran
Reviews.Content: My mother and I have been to Rome eight times in the last few years, and for the most recent four visits have stayed at the Abruzzi. I don't believe that there is a better location in Rome. The Piazza della Rotunda is a lively square, with many bars and restaurants, both on it, and off it, with numerous sidestreets radiating from every corner. A few minutes walk will take you to the Piazza Navona, Campo dei Fiori, Trevi Fountain or the Ghetto. Also nearby is the main shopping thoroughfare of the Via del Corso and the roads leading to the Spanish Steps. The Abruzzi has the most wonderful views of the Pantheon. The receptionists at the hotel are always pleasant and friendly, and the rooms are comfortable and spotless. Although the square is busy, day and night, when the windows are closed, the rooms are quiet. Since discovering the Abruzzi, we wouldn't stay anywhere else in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: steepanddeep4me
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days in Rome prior to a Med cruise at the Abruzzi. It is in a fantastic location, right on the piazza in front of the Pantheon (literally steps from it). We could watch the nightlife and impromtu entertainment so common in Rome right from our room. Our room was clean and comfortable and relatively large by Rome standards. The morning buffet style breakfast was in a restaurant across the piazza and was both good and more than a simple continental type affair. The staff was outstanding and helped us out with directions and restaurant questions (we thought Anthony's down the street had very good food - but there are tons of choices all over, although some much better than other both in taste and value). Being so close to the Pantheon put us in easy walking distance to the Trevi Fountain and Plaza Navorna (5 minutes) as well as the nightly stroll through the historic center with everyone else, really magical and all you dream Rome to be about. We walked to the Colessum/Forum, Spanish Steps, Jewish Ghetto, and Trastevere quite easily as well (between 15-25 minutes each). The bus stop to the Vatican was about 3 or 4 blocks away (5 minutes) and easy to catch (we actually walked back from the Vatican to explore that area more on the way back - 30 to 45 minutes just playing around). The metro is a little bit of a walk (20-30 minutes maybe) so it was not something we used as a result. All things considered this was a great value for the money and exactly what we sought as a central base from which to explore Rome. We definitely would stay there again and recommend it for those wanting to stay in this area of Rome. P.S. If you are going to be in Rome for a few days, make sure you buy a Roma Pass, not only for using public transportation, but also to be able to skip the lines at two of the historical sites (your choice from their list of particpants) whose admission is included for free (particularly the Colessum, where the line to just buy tickets was at least 2 hours long - we literally walked right in with no line for tickets or entry). They have a whole list of places you can use your two free admissions to, but make sure you use it for the Colessum! Also, make sure you reserve a time for your Vatican visit, including buying your tickets online and printing your voucher (the Vatican is not covered by the Roma Pass though). This will also save you at least 2 hours in line waiting to buy tickets, again, we walked right in at our appointed time. Finally if the Borghese is on your list (it should be), you must have reservations (which you can get online) to get in (I think this is also one of the Roma Pass choices).

Reviews.Title: “First time in Italy”
Reviews.Author: adam s s
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our first trip to Italy and while in Rome we stayed at The Hotel Abruzzi. The location cannot be beat as you overlook the Pantheon (Pantheon is amazing). You can walk to just about everywhere from this hotel and the square directly outside the door is always full of people and so much fun. The hotel is old, the rooms are small and you will not get the beds that you may be used to getting staying at a Doubletree or Marriott however I would stay at this hotel 10 out of 10 times. The folks who work at the Hotel Abruzzi are wonderful and so helpful. These people are really nice people. My girlfriend and I loved staying at this hotel and both of us would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Valentina, Nichola, & the Hotel Abruzzi”
Reviews.Author: Kennebeckid
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Hotel Abruzzi was excellent! Although the hotel entrance and front desk are very cramped, the friendliness and help provided by Valentina and the owners son Nichola (I think that is how you spell his name) were very warm, helpful, patient, and friendly. The close proximity of the Pantheon & the view of the Pantheon & Piazza della Rotonda (as featured in the movie Angels & Demons) from our hotel windows were unbelievable and worth every penny! The breakfast was decent and you can sit outside and view the Pantheon, the fountain, and the people sightseeing as you drink your coffee and eat your breakfast. In the movie Angels & Demons, I think the Langdon, the Tom Hanks character mentions that the Pantheon is the oldest catholic church in Rome & the busiest sight. The Piazza della Rotunda is very busy, but the hotel windows keep out the sound. The rooms are small but very nice with wooden floors and very comfortable. The bathrooms are clean and large. There is coffee and tea, along with a pot. The maids are very friendly. Nichola tried to schedule my train tickets to Naples over the phone but finally escorted me to the booking office and made the arrangements for me while I waited. He was extremely nice and super helpful! Finally, Valentina was not only warm and friendly, but she was also very beautiful:-)!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent views and location”
Reviews.Author: BathGarry
Reviews.Content: Hotel Abuzzi was compact but fantastically placed opposite the Pantheon and close to all of the main attractions in Rome. The room was small but very clean with great views. Breakfast was provided in a bar on the main square. lots of restaurants and bars are also near the hotel. Reception staff were very helpful and even upgraded us to the spacious suite at no additional cost when the general strike in Italy delayed our departure for two days.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, perfect location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Sarah R
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon in Aug 2011 and the hotel was a great value. The room was spacious and our window overlooked the fountain and Pantheon. The hotel's breakfast was great and it was a nice perk to sit outside right by the Pantheon. Also, I accidentally left a bag of jewelry behind and the hotel shipped it to me in Greece which was my next destination. Now that's great service! You won't regret staying here, especially if you're on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Ron C
Reviews.Content: Great value. Nice clean rooms though a little small. The location in the piazza della rotunda made it central to all great tourist attractions. we were able to walk to everywhere we wanted to go to in Rome. The piazza proved to be a very livel place at night as well. Recommend that you dont eat anywhere in the piazza as the food is expensive and mediocre. Lots of great restaurants far better priced within 5 minutes walk, particularly on the way to the Trevi Fountain.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Hotel Abruzzi”
Reviews.Author: Branko29
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days, fourth times and we would like to stay here again. The view of the Pantheon every morning and every night was heart warming. The staff was friendly and helpful - especially Antonio and Nikola. Room was every day cleaning. The breakfast in the restaurant on the square near hotel was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and very friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: PJBorrelli
Reviews.Content: We booked our reservation very early (about 8 months) when we planned our trip and specifically requested a room with a view of the Pantheon. About a week before our trip we also decided to take up Hotel Abruzzi's offer of pickup service from the airport, and we are glad we did! We met our arranged driver after baggage claim in Fiumicino Airport and he zipped us to the hotel and we didn't have to learn the train and taxi systems in Rome. Though our driver only spoke a little english he was very polite and pointed out a few of the historic sites on the way in. Once at our hotel we were met by very friendly staff who politely answered all our questions and pointed things that would be helpful to know while we were there. We went up to our room (104) and were very happy with the quality we found (we had seen old pictures but the hotel had been updated since then). The room was spacious and well equipped. The bathroom was spacious and modern (as for the shower head it was mounted on a two foot bar so if you don't like how low it sits then slide it up). Our view out the window looked directly at the entrance to the Pantheon. The included breakfast was at a small caffe across the Piazza della Rotonda where you could eat outside and view the Pahtneon. The Piazza just outside the hotel was constantly busy with people and restaurants and is a part of a Rome night walk and would be bustling until about 2:00 am. We found the noise to be welcome and we attributed it to part of the experience and we fell right asleep despite it, also when we closed the window it blocked the noise almost completely! All in all we had an excellent experience and would definatly reccommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay in the center of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for seeing Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Snorkeller02
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Abruzzi for 3 nights. We are a family with two young children and booked a triple room and paid for an extra bed. We booked directly with the hotel a few months ago and received an early booking discount (I think it was called The Early Bird discount). We requested a room on the fourth floor after reading Trip Adviser reviews that that would make it a quieter stay. The room was a actually two bedrooms with a bathroom. They called it a suite. Room no 401 and 402. It was at the end of the corridor and on the 4th floor. Tea and coffee making facilities, mini bar and tv (Itallian). The room looked out on the Piazza del Rotunda which is where the Pantheon is located, which is free to get into and dates back to Roman times. Breakfast was at the cafe across the square. The hotel does not have a bar or restaurant in it. It has a very small entrance lobby and then you walk up the stairs to the first floor, which is where the lift goes from or you can just walk to the top. It was perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Great Value, Very Knowledgeable”
Reviews.Author: Vinode C
Reviews.Content: It terms of sightseeing, it seems like Rome was built around hotel Abruzzi ! To get more central, the hotel would have to move from across the Pantheon to on top of it. Excellent location! What the hotel lacks in size, it makes up with service and staff knowledge. Got more insights and history from the staff than I did from the tour guides. Great value. Will definitely stay there when I am in Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Charles T
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be very central in Rome and the staff were amazing. As it was my frist stop, I had a lot of questions which were all answered promptly and in a friendly manner. The staff at the hotel were very helpful, which is something I did not find in other Italian hotels where the staff seemed disinterested. The hotel were able to let us check in quite early which we needed as we had just gotten off a 25 hour trip from Sydney. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: llrree
Reviews.Content: It would perhaps be hard to describe any accommodation in Rome as bad, due to the simple fact that it is actually located in this beautiful city… So writing an unbiased review will be nigh impossible… What do the real estate agents say other than “Location, Location, Location”. And that is exactly Hotel Abruzzos selling point. Wake up, peek through the curtains, and look directly at the entrance of the Pantheon, you simply cannot demand more… Most of central Rome is easily accessed on foot, and when you start out in the center of the center, it is as good as it gets. Our room (#02), almost triangular in shape, but with ample space for two, was located in the annex, meaning we had keys for the street door of another building – we only saw the receptionist at check-in & -out. But the little we saw of them gave nothing but a good impression. Cleanliness was also impeccable. We were a little worried that traffic could be annoying in the mornings, but that turned out not to be a problem, at least with the windows closed (AC). The announced wi-fi (paid) was however not available in the annex. Another little snag was the total lack of TV in a language resembling English. The hotel serves its breakfast as coupons for one of the restaurants at the piazza. Eating almost inside the Pantheon is of course a good way to start any day, the food itself was not worth a rave (Rome breakfasts seem to be of varied quality…), and stay away from the black coffee (we suspect it is brewed two days in advance). Order a fresh coffee, or visit the coffee shop across the piazza after breakfast :). Would we come back here another time? They stand a fair chance.

Reviews.Title: “What a FANTASTIC EXPERIENCE! From Location to Staff! WOW!”
Reviews.Author: ForTiffany
Reviews.Content: I took my family (2 grandmas, myself and 2 children) to the Hotel Abruzzi and returned last night... Couldnt wait to put up a top notch review. The location, hands down FANTASTIC. The staff went above and beyond.. When we left too early to make the included breakfast in their selected cafe which overlooks the Pantheon, they made sure that breakfast for 2 was sent to each of my 3 rooms the night before departure. Thank you Antonio, who was a wonderful front desk manager and handled our every need. The rooms, 405, 404, and 106 were fantastic. 404 was the biggest with 2 beds and a very large bathroom, while 405 and 106 had fantastic views. The transportation they set up to and from the airport for 3 different arrivals and departures was like clock work, and the drivers were also fantastic. They had maps and information, recommendations and great staff. The rooms were clean, and well worth the incredible rates. Will stay with the Hotel Abruzzi every time i am in Rome. Great Job!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: blomquist7777
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel that I visited in all my life! Location, staff and the breakfast are amazing. The room are renovated recently, I think 2 years ago and are very quiet and romantic. They have international channells and frigo bar with low price for all the articles (water, coke, juice...). We'll come back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and great staff!”
Reviews.Author: LibbyWestmoreland
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the Hotel Abruzzi. We can't wait until our next trip to Rome. We will stay here again without question. The hotel is very well situated to local tourist attractions, the metro and one of the best places for gelato which is steps from the front door! The staff is most helpful for first timers to Rome. They bent over backwards to answer our questions, point out routes on the map and make suggestions for dining. The rooms were very comfortable and clean (top rated on cleanliness). We loved it and will return to the Hotel Abruzzi.

Reviews.Title: “"Best location ever and can't wait to go back!"”
Reviews.Author: YiliKR
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights while in Rome, and the hotel was in the best location ever close to everything! We stayed in the alcove room which was in a building next to the main building of the hotel, which actually was perfect as it was really quiet, no other guests to really content with, and we still had a picture perfect view of the Pantheon from the window! The rooms were clean, looks new and refurnished with modern furniture and bathroom and beds where comfortable. Price (around 100 euro a night), while not budget price, was fantastic for the location though breakfast is not included in our deal. Would definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: BenandFaye
Reviews.Content: We were actually booked into the partner hotel, Pantheon 3E, where you have to check in to Hotel Abruzzi, and we were told then that there had been a double booking at the Pantheon 3e and so we had a room at the Hotel Abruzzi instead. We were a little disappointed as we had booked the Pantheon 3E specifically because it had more of an apartment feel rather than hotel room and had heard of this happening at this hotel to other travellers. When we got to the room it was very small although with an excellent view of the Pantheon. Not surprised we ended up in one of the smallest rooms in the hotel as it does cost more to stay at Hotel Abruzzi than the Pantheon 3E. My husband mainly had a problem with shower as it was tiny and he is over 6 foot! Overall the room was not the best but for the money I do not think you can find a better hotel right on the Piazza of the Pantheon. To be honest the location of the hotel really made our stay in Rome possible as the cost of sitting at one of the restaurants around the piazza was €7 a beer! So if you want to absorb the atmosphere of Rome at night being able to sit in your room after dinner and watch the buskers right in front of one of the most amazing structures in Rome with a beer you can pick up from the DeSpar on the corner for less than €3 this is the hotel for you. The rooms were cleaned daily and the front reception very helpful. Our flight home wasn't until gone 9pm on our last day and the hotel were happy to look after our luggage in a little room right by reception and allowed us use of a bathroom to freshen up after the day in Rome before our flight. We had breakfast included which was at one of the restaurants on the Piazza in full view of the Pantheon (considering a 1 course meal for 2 with wine was €40 we really appreciated the freebie!). Breakfast included full continental with fresh fruit salad, bacon (cold) scrambled eggs (also cold) and some brilliant cakes that are not to be missed. As the title says this hotel really is about the location as it is so central to all the main sites of ancient Rome. The Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps are about 10 minutes stroll away with the Colosseum not more than 20 minutes (unless you get distracted by the very impressive but quite ugly Vittoriano Monument). When we go back to Rome we would be very tempted to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “MOST ROMANTIC PLACE OF ROME”
Reviews.Author: jack1984043
Reviews.Content: The Abruzzi Hotel is in the center of the city, in front of pantheon that is one of most beautiful temple of rome. Really very nice for a couple!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel for a Roman Holiday!”
Reviews.Author: KieranFlood
Reviews.Content: I was here recently and can say without doubt it is the best hotel I stayed in, in Rome. Look out the window and the Pantheon is directly before you! The hotel was spotlessly clean, and the staff were helpful in the extreme, especially Valentina, who was very helpful with my booking. I'll definitely stay there again next time I visit Rome, and I hope to get room 203 again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location for a budget price”
Reviews.Author: samjay2010
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at the hotel. We paid extra for a view of the Pantheon from our hotel room and in our opinion was worth the extra money. The location of the hotel was fantastic and was only about 30 minutes from both the Colosseum and the Vatican so saved on transport costs. The bedroom was spacious but the bathroom was extremely compact although it catered for all the needs required. Breakfast was served in the Plaza and was a lovely setting for a morning coffee. Due to the central location the amount of restaurants available was limitless, although all the food that we ate was fantastic which also included the restaurant at which we had breakfast, and we were also given a 15% discount voucher when having breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: IsabelAlbl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in front of the Pantheon, 7 min. walk to the Trevy Fountain, 15 min walk to the Spanish Steps, 8 min. drive to the Vatican, 8 min. drive to the Colosseum. Cabs are always available even at 6:00 am when we have to go to the airport. Breakfast was included and it turned out to be a great breakfast that included more than what we expected. The service was great, the personnel at this hotel are very helpful and happy to help at any time. Great restaurants to try around this hotel are "Armando Al Pantheon" and "Da Fortunato Al Pantheon" Rooms are small, clean, and the view is fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sck28
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, the views of the Pantheon are unbeatable. The room was a good size for a city hotel, bed was comfortable, bathroom was not too small, and the air conditioning worked very well in the hot, hot Rome summer. The staff was very friendly and always helpful. We brought our 7 month old and they set up a baby bed and they let us leave our stroller downstairs so we didn't have to bring it up every time we came in. Definitely ask for the Pantheon views!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: corvino3
Reviews.Content: Just got back and it was perfect. Antonio is wonderful. Good for a family of 5. Bring bar soap if you want because they only furnish shampoo.

Reviews.Title: “Bellamisimo”
Reviews.Author: roma47
Reviews.Content: Location perfect,desk helpful,rooms comfortable,air conditioning welcomed and breakfest included...Desk changed our room upon request...lower floor was too noisy...we would definitely rebook ...take advantage of car service and wi fi was only 10 euros for week

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Chuck032
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be just wonderful. The rooms were clean, updated, and very comfortable. The staff was very nice and helpful - Simone, Valentina, and Antonio. Of course, the location is enchanting - right on the square with the Pantheon. Every morning we would open our window and look upon the square in amazement. We were a 15 to 30 minute walk from just about everything that we wanted to see. We really loved the breakfast every morning at the little restaurant across the square - they served eggs, meats, fruit, sweets, bottled water - it was an absolute value. We stayed at similarly priced hotels throughout Italy, and this was as good as it gets. We really have no complaints and no regrets.

Reviews.Title: “Location good, not much else - bedding made my wife break into a rash”
Reviews.Author: jcice
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent, as other reviews have noted. However, there are about ten other hotels also within about 100 meters of Pantheon. We had a double room with Pantheon view. I'd say from the view we must have had one of the better rooms in the hotel. The rooms are small about what you'd expect for 3 star. The bed is where the problems started for us. Another previous review mentioned an itchy reaction to the bedding, they thought it may be bed bugs. My wife also had a skin rash reaction after the first night of sleeping here. We don't think it was bed bugs, rather they likely use cheap commercial detergents or maybe just poor quality sheets. They certainly weren't soft or comfortable. She broke out all over her face, neck, and shoulders. Basically everywhere skin was touching the sheets, so it was clearly from that. In addition to the sheets that cause allergic reactions, the bed was very hard and not comfortable to sleep on at all. Their pillows are like the complimentary airline pillows. How much could new pillows cost? Seriously. The second night the power went out, so this made our misery go up even more as it was very hot. The hotel employee (and there was usually only one working at a time) was very unhelpful and claimed the block was out, even though the restaurant downstairs and the hotel next door had power. The power was out for nearly 3 hours, so we lost a night of rest that really threw us off schedule. Not even an apology was offered to us when we checked out. They acted like nothing happened. You'd think they would have at least offered an apology, even if it wasn't their fault. Literally did not care, said very little to us at all during checkout. Additionally, they have the antiquated "leave your key at the front desk when you leave" system, which is a little annoying to have to ask for your key every time you come and go. Also, when we checked out, no help was offered for our bags, as only one person was working. And the lift does not go all the way to the ground floor, you have to carry your bags up one flight of stairs yourself. I haven't even gotten to the shower, which if you are over 5'5" have fun getting your hair wet. Bathroom was tiny as expected, but couldn't they at least raise the shower head 6-8"? Overall, I would not recommend this hotel. If you want to stay near the Pantheon, try one of the surrounding hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Dorris080
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location besides the fantastic Pantheon. The reception and the stairways aren´t fancy, but who cares if it is a OK price considering the location. Friendly staff. Breakfast was served at a restaurant at the Piazza della Rotonda in front of Pantheon and since it was May we were able to sit outside facing Pantheon. We thought that was great. The breakfast buffet was OK. Compared to many other "continental" breakfasts i Rome it was quiet allright.

Reviews.Title: “The right choice in value and unbeatable location!”
Reviews.Author: marciopsiq
Reviews.Content: We had previously stayed at the opposite Albergo Del Senato and loved the hotel and its location. But since the rates at the Senato were sky high for our dates we have decided to try the Abruzzi(almost half the price), as the reviews were nice and we could have a view to the Pantheon. That has proven to be a smart choice, because altough the room and bathroom were quite simple, they were also very comfortable, with a reasonable size, very clean and with one of the best possible views in Rome! Breakfast in a restaurant at the Piazza de la Rotonda was charming! Staff was nice, except for the receptionist who was there in our early morning check out: he couldn't properly charge our credit cards and kept repeating, almost rudely, that there were credit issues, when there weren't. But he eventually has managed to charge our bill. The driver that the hotel arranged to take us to the airport was eficient.

Reviews.Title: “i wouldn't stay anywhere else in Rome”
Reviews.Author: BabyBrooklyn
Reviews.Content: I go to Rome once or twice a year with my wife or cousin and we wouldn't stay anywhere else. It is right in the center of old historic center of Rome in the best area Piazza della Rotonda facing the PANTHEON. For me the most amazing structure in Rome. We wake up in the morning and there is the Pantheon facing you 100 feet away and the piazza right below you. It is an amazing boutique hotel that is most gracious and the rates are extremely reasonable especially for that area. The hotel has just undergone major renovations much to my surprise keeping the charm and comfort one needs. Don't miss this place I highly recommend it. Chris

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: bdnv08
Reviews.Content: We have just returned home from a wonderful honeymoon in Rome. Hotel Abruzzi proved to be just what we hoped for - always gentle and helpful staff, clean and pleasant room with air-condition, central location and nice and varied breakfast. We were overwhelmed by the view of Pantheon from the room, so close that we felt we could almost touch the ancient walls. Staying for one week, we actively explored some of the numerous treasures of the city of Rome, always by foot from/to the hotel. Hotel Abruzzi will be our choice for next year's reunion with Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: choctaw14
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night at the end of our trip. The location of this hotel is awesome. It's close to everything once you get there. Getting there can be a little tricky, you have to take the 64 bus and make sure to validate your bus ticket or you could get the dreaded fine (couple hundred euro!), which I saw another couple get. Regardless, the hotel is nice and the staff is excellent. They were very nice, and since we were leaving before 8am the next day they wrapped up our breakfast and brought it to our room, as well as got us a private cab to the airport. It was worth the extra ten euros to get a nice car and driver to take us to the airport. Also, being that close to the Pantheon was fantastic. Wait till about 7PM or go super early when the crowds are sparse. Awesome stay and I would recommend this place, although it is a little pricey.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel room in the Piazza Del la Rotunda had the best view of the Pantheon.”
Reviews.Author: droggiero
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 103 and the best view of the Pantheon. The room was small but nicely furnished and it was clean. It had a/c, Bidet...used for bathing the genital and perineal areas" very common in Europe and south America". The staff was very pleasant and very professional. Thank you Guys and see you soon. :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, friendly staff, perfect for a short break”
Reviews.Author: IanFromCork
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 5 nights for a break in Rome, and it's perfect for seeing Rome. The staff were friendly, professional and "on the ball". They were expecting me when I arrived and had me booked in and in my room in under 4 minutes, and I was given a discount for a meal in a nearby restaurant. I overheard them discussing/arranging/booking a night at the opera for other guests and were advising them of the best seats value wise, etc. Breakfast is in a nearby cafe. While that may sound a bit off-putting, I enjoyed watching Rome come to life while having my breakfast. There was adequate tea/coffee making facilities in the room. The Location is almost perfect. It's a 10 minute walk to Piazza Navona, 15 minutes to the Colosseum and 20 minutes to the Vatican. The Pantheon is literally outside the door. The nearest taxi rank is 15 seconds away (meaning that no pick-up fair applies to a journey). The room, while being a single, was adequate. There was a minibar, tea/coffee making facilities, a large bed, large wardrobe, writing desk, controllable a/c, etc. The bathroom was spotless, with loads of water pressure in the shower. The Minibar was large enough to take a couple of extra 500ml bottles of water (from the supermarket around the corner). The only problem there is the Gelateria outside the door. I couldn't pass it without sampling the ice-cream!

Reviews.Title: “Be careful...not so charming”
Reviews.Author: Arzillo
Reviews.Content: I reserved there for a relative; one night. They promise the position (true) and the view (depends........ ) Result: one very very very tiny room, looking over a very narrow inside; for 184 euro a night not a bargain at all. No price reduction in such a situation. Never again. I am frequently in Rome,and I wil not be their customer.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: jkb194805
Reviews.Content: My third visit to this great little hotel In answer to previous reviews the breakfast has been upgraded and there is the incomparable advantge of eating it in the sunshine in full view of the Pantheon and the wakening life of Piazza Rotonda Rooms are very comfortable and again the marvellous view And staff very friendly and helpful Where else would you want to stay in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - the best vaccation for us ever”
Reviews.Author: holthus
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is perfect for a trip to Rome - situated in the center - and we could walk to all the nice and historic places, that we wanted to visit. The Hotel is very nice - and the personnel very helpfull in any way. The breakfast table in the Restaurant just outside the door is perfect as well.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
