Reviews.Author: AnneBOslo
Reviews.Content: Nice and helpful staff = great service. Fantastic location. We got a beautiful room, overlooking Piazza della Rotunda and Pantheon. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views, best lcation”
Reviews.Author: smwalter
Reviews.Content: I went to Rome on a very short stay--only two nights. My goal was to pack the major sites into my time, visiting them all on foot. The location of this hotel made it possible! Pros: Abruzzi is literally located on the same plaza as the Pantheon, which is a little intimidating at first. Every room has an incredible view, and you just can't beat your location at the center of everything historical. The staff was friendly, and the room was clean and comfortable. I had a private bathroom, though I'm not 100% all rooms have this. See if you can request it. Breakfast buffet is included, and facilitated by a trattorio across the plaza (very short walk). Cons: If you can't handle street noise, this is not the place for you. There were people outside my window visiting at the fountain, singing and playing instruments until 4 in the morning. I found it somewhat charming, but I know most people wouldn't. The rooms were definitely European size, but I was by myself, and didn't spend much time inside, except to sleep. Overall, I had a great experience with this hotel, and would recommend it to friends and family. I was watching Roman Holiday the other night, and literally saw my hotel room window in a scene where Audrey Hepburn and Gregory Peck are having drinks on the piazza--you can't beat that!

Reviews.Title: “A charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: colleman1954
Reviews.Content: Hotel Abruzzi has been a great surprise! We staied in a room with a excellent view on the Pantheon. The room was very clean, the staff is really nice and gentle. We already benn in this Hotel last year but this time we got a sorprise that is the breakfast, in fact the place has been changed and they now offer a buffet american breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service here!”
Reviews.Author: terrik
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Abruzzi as we had fallen in love with the Piazza della Rotunda. The first hotel we stayed at in the area was unable to extend our stay as they were already booked. We were supposed to move to a hotel down near Spanish Steps and loved this Pantheon area so much that we wanted to remain there. We walked into the Abruzzi and they were able to accomodate us in a 2 days notice! They also took the time to help us cancel our reservation at the other hotel. They were kind enough to store our luggage for us as we were traveling to Positano for the weekend. When we came back, our luggage was waiting for us in our room. We felt very cared for by the reception staff. They helped us with many different requests. They went above and beyond for us. The rooms were perfectly adequate, The breakfast (which was located right across the Piazza) was very good and plentiful. Our only small complaint is that while this hotel is a 'non-smoking" hotel, there were people in their rooms that were smoking. But, when we called the front desk about it, they quickly attended to this situation and solved the problem. I would recommend this hotel to anybody!

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Branko29
Reviews.Content: We were stayed here many times and written a couple of reviews. This was our third visit in last time and we had still and excelent stay. And we will back here in August again. The location of Hotel Abruzzi is great - just in front of the Pantheon and in the hearth of Rome (ideal position for everything). Room was super clean. The hotel staff is very, very friendly and helpful - very nice people /Antonio, Simone, Nicola/. Romantic breakfast in the Caffe just in front of the Pantheon has good choices - fruit, meat, cheese, bread, scrambled eggs, dolci, tortes, youghurt, cereals... They make very good italiano cappuccino. We higly recommend . We love Rome and Hotel Abruzzi, too.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: bigbear13
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent eight nights of our honeymoon in Hotel Abruzzi, the experience was wonderful. LOCATION: Wonderful! This was our first trip to Rome, we wanted to hit up the usual spots in ancient Rome and we were not disappointed. The hotel is actually located on the Piazza Rotunda which was recently closed to automobile traffic, so the atmosphere is extremely charming with restaurants, live music and people all around. We spent an enormous amount of time walking the city and it was always a relief to enter the Piazza Rotunda and our Hotel Abruzzi. STAFF: Very accommodating, friendly and helpful with directions. HOTEL ITSELF: Very, very clean and all the comforts we needed. Rooms were not huge, but we were in Rome and the idea was to stay out of our room anyway. I thought internet was cheap at an extra 10 euro for 24 hours of actual usage, could be spread out over your entire stay (4 hours on Tuesday, 2 hours on Wednesday, yada yada). Laundry service was very expensive at 6 euro for a shirt, 2 euro for socks, and so on. We used a laundromat near Piazza Barbarini (5 minute walk) for 8 euro per load, took 90 minutes total and we just had coffee and shopped. BILLING: I booked directly through their site and got an email quoting a price and saying I "would get an additional 15% off for stays over 3 nights". But apparently that 15% off is already calculated on the price they initially quote you. I don't think they were being intentionally deceptive with that, but it was something we had a difference of opinions on. They gave me a discounted price on my final night to make things right, but it's something to confirm with them anyway. OVERALL: This is the place I will be staying on every trip to Rome and I'll be sending my friends and family there as well! Wonderful restaurants are all around, you're five minute walk from six or seven of Ancient Rome's most historic and beautiful places. We easily walked to Spanish Steps, Coliseum, Pantheon (obviously), Plaza Novena, Trevi Fountain, Plaza Barbarini, and everything else we wanted to see. 8 euro cab ride to Vatican, 12 euro cab to Via Appia.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a precruise stay”
Reviews.Author: renee44
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our night at the Abruzzi. It was our first time in Rome and we found the location perfect for exploring the city. The double rooms were larger than expected but the quad suite would probably be better suited to a family with children then four adults if you are staying more than a night or two. The staff spoke great English and was helpful and friendly. If we are ever lucky enough to go back to Rome, I would certainly consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful return to the Abruzzi Hotel..”
Reviews.Author: Dublin2011Dublin
Reviews.Content: Just back home from a recent stay here with extended family. The hotel staff including reception, cleaning ladies and maintenance were all extremely professional and friendly. The views from the hotel room and location in centro storico is the main reason we chose to stay here (and the fact that I stayed here with friends 12 years ago!). The breakfast across the Piazza is lovely, totally comprehensive and kept all of us going each day! I would definitely return here if i am luck enough to return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Bug0003
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel in a perfect location! To wake up and see the Pantheon outside our window was very surreal. The staff were all extremely friendly and helpful. A great breakfast was included at a a nearby restaurant (in the same square as the hotel and the Pantheon). Although not free, the wi-fi was fast and always had a great signal the entire time we were there. The rooms were very clean, though quite small. but thats to be expected in a European city anyway so it was not a negative. Next time I visit Rome, i will definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to be in Rome”
Reviews.Author: zvoomb
Reviews.Content: Yes, it's expensive for what it is, but you sleep and shower at the shadow of the Pantheon. And then most of the things that are worth seeing in Rome are§ around the corner. The breakfast is offered at a nearby café, at the square, it's sumptuous for an Italian breakfast (although one can get better quality in more breakfast-conscious countries). The staff is generally very good and we were offered a round trip to the airport for 100 euros (up to 3 people). I don't see why I should go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Just outstanding for the value”
Reviews.Author: drtravels
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location with a most helpful staff. Prompt replies to emails and happy to help with any questions. While the rooms are a bit small and rather cheaply done over with veneer wood, the view out into the streets and Pantheon is a perfect way to watch Rome. I was on the fourth floor which gives a better view and no noise from above. Breakfast is buffet style from a nearby restaurant which is average in quality but filling. I used airline miles to book this hotel which I thought was a great value - 33,000 miles for 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location just in front of the Pantheon!”
Reviews.Author: marco_zzz
Reviews.Content: amazing location just in front of the Pantheon and friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: sharon7890
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very old building completely renovated for modern conforts. Our room was very confortable and quite, even though the Piazza della Rotonda, out the front door, is like a party every night. The location, just diagonally across the square from the Pantheon ( an ancient temple now used as a Christian Church-- architecturally a marvel) is a tremendous adva ntage. A great many of the most interesting sights in Rome are a short walk away, as are any number of restaurant and shop. This is a boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back soon in Rome and at Hotel Abruzzi”
Reviews.Author: AnnaGJ
Reviews.Content: Excelent location, friendly and relaxed service - nothing to complain about. We cant´t wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: nico1964
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Abruzzi from 18 December until 27 December 2010. Everything was just perfect: the (payed) limo service from and to the airport, the location of the hotel just in front of the Pantheon in the heart of the centre of Rome!, the kindness of Antonio and his staff, the quality of the beds (and I am 1.95 meter tall!), the daily cleaning service of our room, the breakfast service just around the corner. Hotel Abruzzi and it's staff made it for us a perfect Christmas holiday. I love Rome, I love the hotel Abruzzi. And we definitely will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Why go anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: MarkKingscliff
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Denmark, Spain, Morocco and saved the best till last when we stayed in Rome at the Hotel Abruzzi for 7 nights. What a gem of a hotel in the heart of this amazing city. We shared connecting room 401/402 with our eldest daughter who was travelling with us and it was just perfect for our every need. Rooms face the Piazza and The Pantheon across the cobbled square; step outside, turn left and in 5 mins you are standing in front of The Trevi Fountain; 5 mins more and you are at the Palatino, Roman Forum and The Colosseum. Take a walk in any other direction and around every corner is what you came to Rome for. We had our complimentary breakfast at the Miscellania Restaurant across the piazza and a superb evening meal there as well. The driver of our airport transfer van dropped two British businesswomen at a very plush 5 star hotel first, which was a bit daunting, before he entered the narrow streets leading to the Abruzzi and he said that we would like our hotel, very well run, comfortable and close to everything. Taxi drivers, they know everything, and he was 100% correct. If taking photos inside museums etc, obey the signs and remember - NO FLASH, these things are priceless.

Reviews.Title: “The best location ever!”
Reviews.Author: robertsonsimon1
Reviews.Content: I happened to go to Rome because of my job, but I actually had such a lovely time that my business trip turned into an unforgettable holiday. My staying at Hotel Abruzzi was perfect, I could relax after my stressful day and enjoy the magnificent view of the Pantheon.

Reviews.Title: “Piazza della Rotunda”
Reviews.Author: Peter4Hobbs
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Hotel Abruzzi. Our room was on the second floor, above the lobby (third floor) with a great view of the piazza. The modern double glazed windows do a fine job of noise control. In any case t he crowds subside by 11:00. The staff are all great people. We stayed six nights so we meet them all. While there is no breakfast room guests are given vouchers for the cafe across the piazza for coffee(s) and cornetto(s)--very nice! The location is perfect in the centro storico. You can walk to most sites or take the little electric bus, #16 to things farther away. Numerous gelato bars near. I love the stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and wanderfull location”
Reviews.Author: AlfredPais
Reviews.Content: We spent nice days and we had the opportunity to see a fabolous phanteon's view from our room

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, average for overall value”
Reviews.Author: Beemy
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed in this hotel earlier this month. We have visited Rome a number of times and stayed in a couple of different hotels but we especially like the area around Piazza della Rotunda so decided on the Abruzzi. The location is excellent but it only has a minute lobby on the ground floor. Our room was on the first floor and we had a view into the piazza and with the Pantheon to the left and the fountain in front. Our room was quite small but adequate; our bathroom was very nice, a super shower with abundant hot water and clean towels every day. The chamber maids did an excellent job. I was not aware when we booked that breakfast was served in a cafe opposite but this worked well and was a very pleasant start to the day - until our last morning when it was very wet and cold. The hotel itself has no facilities apart from a small lounge on the first floor; this did not bother us as we were out most of the time. There was a power cut for almost a whole day but this affected nearby buildings too so was not the fault of the hotel. We enjoyed our stay but thought it was quite expensive for the limited facilites, though of course we realised we were paying for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Location, Good Room, Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: drimazza
Reviews.Content: Just in front of Pantheon.Who is looking for good location , good room and fair price , this is definitely a good option. But, do not count with any hotel services Indeed, attention to park your car, in case you rent one. Private cars barely reach the hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Magical setting”
Reviews.Author: BlouBulJHB
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel overlooking the Pantheon - you can almost touch it. Amazing to open the windows and to listen to the music coming from the streets Friendly staff and very helpful to identify the attractions. Thank you for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ab1847
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at Pantheon 3E (the hotels guesthouse) but on arrival we were told we were "upgraded" to stay in the main hotel, Hotel Abruzzi. The hotel is in a fabulous location, literally at the Pantheon. The room was nice size and extremely clean. The staff were all friendly and helpful. The only negatives were that we barely had any warm water and at times it was completely cold. We mentioned it to everyone working the front and were just told it was because too many people were showering at once! I'd expect better from a hotel in this price range. Secondly, you need to pay for wireless access. I didn't mind paying, but then the signal did not reach our room, I could only use it in the common room. Not a huge problem, but annoying. Overall it was an ok hotel, I wouldn't mind staying here again, but would look at others first.

Reviews.Title: “Great View and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: M&MRochesterHills
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 204 and I don't think any hotel room in the Piazza della Rotunda could have a better view of the Pantheon. The room was small but nicely furnished and it was clean. It had a/c too which would be very important in the summer. The staff was very pleasant and very professional.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: karlludvic
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here for the one night however other members of the group I travelling with stayed for four days. This is a gem in the heart of Rome. The location is second to none being only a few paces from Navona Square, Trevi Fontain and a short walk from Spanish Square. The staff where very friendly and made us feel very welcome even with a two year old. The rooms were clean and the Pantheon View was amazing!!! In summary this is a stop-on base for exploring Rome and I would recommend the Hotel Abruzzi to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Can't think of a negative.”
Reviews.Author: RocketRaccoon
Reviews.Content: Awesome location on the delightful Piazza Rotunda, with a beautiful view of the Pantheon from the front windows. The staff at the tiny little reception desk were always happy, friendly and eager to assist. Small rooms, but perfectly clean and serviceable. Their continental breakfast is served at a sidewalk cafe across the square... fountain-side! OK, maybe the lift (which doesn't serve the ground floor) is a bit slow and steamy, but our four-day stay here was a delight.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location Great staff”
Reviews.Author: colm2010
Reviews.Content: This was an absolutely brilliant location overlooking the Pantheon and a bustling square. Loads of restaurants and street entertainment in the many streets surrounding the hotel. Very convenient base for visiting the main sights of Rome, all in within 30 mins walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location - excellent quality - reasonable price - Thanks!”
Reviews.Author: clickVivaldi
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a comfortable hotel near the Pantheon so that we could have access to the Reinassance Rome ... and the shopping Rome :-) at a family frienly price. We tried this hotel because my family is originally from the Abruzzi region, we liked the location and the price... and we got lucky! We plan to return to this charming and elegant hotel next time we visit Rome

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Branko29
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rome for 5 nights. The staff at Hotel Abruzzi were very friendly and helpful and made us feel at home. Location is beautiful, only a few steps to all historical places in the heart of Rome. The room with fantastic view to Pantheon was daily cleaning. We recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: cynthia951
Reviews.Content: Great location! They gave us a nice room with a small balconey overlooking the square and with a view of the Pantheon to the left. Hotel close to taxi stand, supermarket, restaurants, other major sites, and Tazza d'Oro (Rick Steves recommended as best coffee place). The only negative was that the air conditioning didn't seem to be cool enough (it only went as low as 16 degrees celsius but didn't feel like it was cold) and the bed wasn't too comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: jetlagged5
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights here and loved it. We felt safe, and the front desk was very helpful. There is no bellman, but there is a lift. Ask for a room with a Pantheon view. A simple breakfast was included at the restaurant across the piazza, looking at the Pantheon. The only problem was an air conditioner that was sometimes noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Pantheon View in heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: madhatr00
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in Rome at the end of our two week trip and had just left the beautiful Sorrento. The Hotel Abruzzi was larger than our first two hotels on the vacation but was not big by any comparison. I had read that the hotel rooms here were tiny. I didn't find that but they were not large. The bathroom was spacious though but little counter space. One of the main reasons to stay here is 1.) it is close to about everything. 20 minute walk to Coliseum, 10 minutes to Trevi Fountain, 30 minutes to Vatican and 2.) when you open your window you are staring directly at the Pantheon. Unfortunately for us, half of the Pantheon was under restoration but lucky for us, when we opened our window we weren't able to see the scaffolding. The power went out for about an hour while there but staff was courteous and made sure we were comfortable. Instead of waiting around we just walked around the city

Reviews.Title: “ABRUZZI HOTEL WAS AN OASIS IN ROME”
Reviews.Author: TimboCedarFalls_IA
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 6 nights in Rome at the Albergo Abruzzi hotel and it couldn't have been a more pleasant experience. The hotel couldn't be in a better location directly across from the Pantheon!! And since its on a corner I think a lot of its rooms have great views- our room looked out on the piazza and the Pantheon and each night various street musicians would strike up song outside our windows- and we could enjoy the excitement of the piazza from the comfort of our room. The staff was VERY pleasant and very efficient. They always greeted you with a pleasant hello and were onsite nearly 24 hours a day to meet our needs. Breakfast is served free at an outside cafe across the square from the Pantheon- Internet was only 10 euros for 24 hours of use which lasted me the entire week (you could buy less but for 10 euros I liked feeling it was limitless). The only downside is the hotel is not near the Metro- however, after a couple of days we figured a very efficient way to walk to the Spango Spanish Steps metro line and it became easy to jump on the subway. An easier way when you're first there is get on at the Colosseum and you realize its pretty easy to find your way to the hotel from that area as well. But the charm of Pantheon area was worth the walk to the metro. Don't let the outside of the hotel freak you out- its just in a very very very old square- inside its very nice and modern. I thought the old world Italian charm of the outside was pretty cool

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Abruzzi
HotelInfo.Address: P.zza della Rotonda, 69, 00186 Rome, Italy
